Algorithm: It is a set of instructions or rules that are followed to solve a problem or perform a specific task.
Data Structure: It is a way of organizing and storing data so that it can be accessed and modified efficiently.
Programming Language: It is a formal language comprising a set of instructions that produce various kinds of output.
Binary Search: It is an algorithm used to find the position of a specific value within a sorted array.
Array: It is a data structure that stores a collection of elements, each identified by at least one array index or key.
Linked List: It is a linear collection of elements, where each element points to the next one, forming a chain-like structure.
Recursion: It is a programming technique in which a function calls itself in order to solve smaller instances of the same problem.
